description:
The `bulkDeleteReviews()` function returns a promise which resolves to the `jobId`. The `jobId` is a unique ID that can be used to refer to that specific bulk delete.

All reviews that meet the specified filter criteria are deleted. To perform a dry run, use the intended filter options with `queryReviews()`.

When this function is used, a bulk job is started and `jobId` is returned. The job might not complete right away, depending on its size.

description:
The `createReview()` function returns a promise that resolves to the created review.

This function requires a `contactId`.

If the review author does not have a contact ID, use `createReviewAndContact()`.

If `authorName` is left empty, the member's name will be used. If the author is not a member, the field is left `null`.

The `getReview()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the retrieved review.

By default, an unpublished review is not returned. To retrieve an unpublished review, pass `returnPrivateReviews` as `true`.

docs.summary: Creates a query to retrieve a list of reviews.
description: The `queryReviews()` function builds a query to retrieve a list of reviews and returns a `ReviewsQueryBuilder` object.
The returned object contains the query definition, which is typically used to run the query using the  `find()` function.
You can refine the query by chaining `ReviewsQueryBuilder` functions onto the query.
`ReviewsQueryBuilder` functions enable you to sort, filter,
and control the results that `queryReviews()` returns.
The `queryReviews()` function runs with the following defaults, which you can override:
- `ascending("_createdDate")`

The functions that are chained to `queryReviews()` are applied in the order they're called. For example, if you apply `descending("_createdDate")` and then `descending("content.rating")`, the results are sorted first by the `_createdDate`, and then, if there are multiple results with the same `_createdDate`, the items are sorted by `content.rating`.
|PROPERTY	|SUPPORTED FILTERS & SORTING
|`namespace`|[`eq()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#in)|
|`_id`|[`eq()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#in)|

|`content.rating`|[`eq()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#in),[`lt()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#lt),[`le()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#le),[`gt()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#gt),[`ge()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#ge),[`ascending()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`_createdDate`|[`eq()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#in),[`lt()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#lt),[`le()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#le),[`gt()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#gt),[`ge()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#ge),[`ascending()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`helpfulness`|[`eq()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#in),[`lt()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#lt),[`le()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#le),[`gt()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#gt),[`ge()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#ge),[`ascending()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#descending)|
|`moderation.moderationStatus`|[`eq()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#in)|

|`verified`|[`eq()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#ne),[`ascending()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`origin.type`|[`eq()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#ne),[`ascending()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`relevanceScore`|[`eq()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#in),[`lt()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#lt),[`le()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#le),[`gt()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#gt),[`ge()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#ge),[`ascending()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-reviews-v2.Reviews.ReviewsQueryBuilder#descending)|

docs.summary: Updates the moderation status of a review.
description:
Possible moderation statuses:
-  APPROVED: The review is published and viewable by site visitors.
-  REJECTED: The review is declined and not viewable by site visitors.

examples.title: updateModerationStatus example for dashboard page code
updateModerationStatus example for exporting from backend code

description:
The `updateReview()` function returns a promise that resolves to the updated review.

Each time the review is updated, `revision` increments by 1. The existing `revision` must be included
when updating the review. This ensures you're working with the latest review information, and it prevents unintended overwrites.

This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

examples.title: updateReview example for dashboard page code
body: const result = await reviews.updateReview(id, review, options);

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest

Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.name: deletedEntityAsJson

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: manuallyChanged
members.doc:
Indicates whether a moderator manually changed the `moderationStatus` of the review.

If the `moderationStatus` changed automatically because the review
passed the moderation rules or if moderation is turned off, this field is set to `false`.

members.name: moderationStatus
members.doc:
- `APPROVED`: The review is approved and published.
- `IN_MODERATION`: The review is pending moderation. Moderation can be applied in the site owner's [Dashboard](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Select%20Site&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https:%2F%2Fwww.wix.com%2Fdashboard%2F%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D%2Freviews/pending).
- `REJECTED`: The review is rejected and not visible in the site.
- `SUBMITTED`: Initial status of the review before the moderation process.

description: Moderation status of the review.

members.name: previousModerationStatus
members.doc:
The previous moderation status of the review.
- `APPROVED`: The review is approved and published.
- `IN_MODERATION`: The review is pending moderation. Moderation can be applied in the site owner's [Dashboard](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Select%20Site&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https:%2F%2Fwww.wix.com%2Fdashboard%2F%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D%2Freviews/pending).
- `REJECTED`: The review is rejected and not visible in the site.
- `SUBMITTED`: Initial status of the review before the moderation process.

members.name: namespace
members.doc: Review namespace. Currently integrated with Wix Stores, as `stores`.

members.name: origin
members.doc:
Provides information about the origin of the review.
Organic reviews are created by site visitors or members.
App reviews are created by apps even though a site visitor or member is the author of the review.
Apps can not create or update organic reviews.

members.name: publishCount
members.doc:
The number of times this review has been published after being approved by moderation.
If the moderation is disabled, review is automatically APPROVED and counted as published.

members.name: relevanceScore
members.doc:
relevance score calculated by reviews platform based on review content. Used to sort reviews by relevance to reviewed
item

members.name: reply
members.doc: Reply to the review.

members.name: reviewDate
members.doc:
Date and time then review was written. It should the same time as created_date except for reviews
that were imported from the other review system.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the review is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes,
the current revision must be passed when updating the review.
Ignored when creating a review.

members.name: verified
members.doc: Indicates whether the review has been verified through a Verify Product Purchase call to the Review Product catalog SPI.

description:
A Review object includes all of the details related to the review of an entity. An entity is a specific resource to be reviewed,
for example, a store product.
You can manage existing reviews, create new reviews, and retrieve reviews.
Read more about reviews in this [tutorial](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-adding-and-setting-up-wix-reviews).

members.name: body
members.doc:
Review body.

Max: 3,000 characters

members.name: media
members.doc:
List of media items associated with the review.

Max: 10 items

members.name: rating
members.doc:
Rating of the review.

Min: `1`

Max: `5`
